snippet: The Nationals’ decision to end the successful season of the young pitcher Stephen Strasburg, who had elbow reconstruction surgery in 2010, has drawn mixed reactions from baseball fans.
abstract: Washington Nationals, who are pursuing their city’s first baseball championship in 88 years, are voluntarily sitting down one of their best players in an endorsement of prudence and caution; decision to end the successful season of the young pitcher Stephen Strasburg, who had elbow reconstruction surgery in 2010, has drawn mixed reactions from baseball fans.
lead_paragraph: The Nationals’ decision to end the successful season of the young pitcher Stephen Strasburg, who had elbow reconstruction surgery in 2010, has drawn mixed reactions from baseball fans.

headline.seo: Stephen Strasburg Shutdown Earns Nationals Mixed Reactions
headline.main: In Capital, Protecting a Treasured Right (Arm)
headline.print_headline: In Capital, Protecting a Treasured Right (Arm)
